title: Mauricio Pochettino blames 'emotional impact' of Hugo Lloris injury for toothless Tottenham display
text:
Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino blamed the 'emotional impact' of Hugo Lloris' horrific injury for his side's 3-0 defeat to Brighton.

Lloris landed awkwardly, three minutes in, after stumbling behind his own goalline as he spilled Pascal Gross' cross into the path of Neal Maupay, who tapped home the opener.

The goalkeeper appeared to dislocate his arm and was given oxygen inside his own goal as he received lengthy treatment before being stretchered off the pitch.

Hugo Lloris spilled Pascal Gross' third minute cross before stumbling into his own goal

Lloris landed awkwardly as Neal Maupay tapped home Brighton's opener from just yards out

Lloris was left screaming in agony inside his own goal and required lengthy treatment

The goalkeeper was given oxygen before being stretchered off the pitch at the Amex Stadium

Brighton seized control of the game thereafter and a double from winger Aaron Connolly gave the home side a deserved 3-0 win.

Spurs' below-par display came off the back of a 7-2 thrashing at the hands of Bayern Munich in the Champions League on Wednesday, but Pochettino felt it was Lloris' injury that affected the performance of his players.

'Hugo Lloris' injury had massive impact on the game,' he told BT Sport. 'It was so early in the game. To concede so early and losing our captain it had an emotional impact on the team. We tried to find solutions, a different way to play but it was impossible. It's a very difficult moment.'

Pochettino believes the emotional impact of Lloris' injury was to blame for Spurs' performance

Pochettino's future has been called into question following a disastrous start to the season which has seen Spurs lose three of their opening eight Premier League games but the Argentinian has urged everyone at the club to remain united.

'I want to say thank you to the fans, it was a big effort to the fans and we put out that performance,' he added. 'We were at the top together but now we need to get more. It is not easy.

'After five-and-a-half years this is the first tough time we are having. There is a feeling that this is not good at the minute. We are feeling the emotion. I want to keep working hard and believing.

'I hope the pressure is coming to me and leaves the pressure off the players. Now is a moment to be strong. We cannot underestimate the situation but we need to work. There is always the possibility to make us stronger.'
description: Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino blamed the 'emotional impact' of Hugo Lloris' horrific injury for his side's 3-0 defeat to Brighton as Spurs limped to a third league defeat this term.
